column2: UTAH DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: towards the right side of the road.
column10: towards the left side of the road.

column2: 2. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column6: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column8: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column10: sound your horn and move to the left lane.

column2: 3. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
4. This road sign means:
5. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: drive slowly so you can check traffic.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
10. This sign means:
column6: the road may be slippery when wet.
column8: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 11. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column6: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.

column2: 12. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 13. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column8: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 14. This sign means:
15. This sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 16. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 17. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 18. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 19. Regulatory signs are:
20. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
21. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.

column2: 22. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
23. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 24. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
25. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
